text: Ochrosia fatuhivensis was a species of plant in the family Apocynaceae. It was endemic to Fatu Hiva in Marquesas Islands of French Polynesia, but is reported to be extinct.Kew World Checklist of Selected Plant FamiliesFlorence, J. 1998. Ochrosia fatuhivensis. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 22 August 2007. ==References== fatuhivensis Category:Flora of the Marquesas Islands Category:Flora of French Polynesia Category:Extinct flora of Oceania Category:Plant extinctions since 1500 Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Ochrosia fatuhivensis
